title: Tear gas fired as inmates clash in Matara Prison
byline: (UPDATED) Sri Lanka Police says that the clash between two groups of inmates in the Matara Prison is still continuing with tear gas fired to control the situation.

title: Dan Priyasad succumbs to gunshot wounds
byline: The convenor of the “Nawa Sinhale National Movement” and political activist, Dan Priyasad, has succumbed to his injuries after being hospitalized following a shooting incident in Wellampitiya last night (22).

title: Fairly heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department says that showers or thundershowers will occur in most parts of the island after 1.00 p.m. today (23).

title: Gunmen open fire on tourists in Himalayan region, killing at least 26 people
byline: At least 26 people have been killed and a dozen injured in a suspected terror attack in the disputed Himalayan region of Jammu and Kashmir, authorities said Tuesday.

title: ‘You have a right to know what happens to your tax money’ – PM Harini
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya stated that the taxes paid by the people should have value and that the public has a right to know how those funds are being used.

title: Unrest at Matara Prison brought under control
byline: Sri Lanka Police says that the unrest which erupted at the Matara Prison has now been brought under control.

title: 2025 LG Polls: ‘E-Service’ launched to assist postal voters
byline: The Election Commission says that an ‘e-service’ has been made available to assist postal voters in locating their designated voting location and certifying officer.

title: Heavy traffic at Borella due to fallen tree; 7 vehicles damaged
byline: A tree has fallen near the Cemetery Roundabout in Borella, damaging seven vehicles and causing severe traffic congestion, police reported.

title: Cardinal Malcolm Ranjith leaves for the Vatican
byline: The Archbishop of Colombo, His Eminence Cardinal Malcolm Ranjith, departed for the Vatican this morning (23).

title: Special announcement for ‘Siri Dalada Wandanawa’ attendees
byline: Sri Lanka Police have issued a special notice to devotees participating in the ongoing ‘Siri Dalada Wandanawa’ exposition at the Temple of the Tooth Relic in Kandy.

title: Flash flood hits Chilaw
byline: A flash flood situation has occurred in Chilaw city, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Sri Lanka’s economy shows remarkable recovery in 2024, says World Bank
byline: Sri Lanka’s economy has made a remarkable recovery in 2024, surpassing growth expectations by recording 5 percent growth, compared to the projected 4.4 percent, says the World Bank.

title: All inmates of Matara Prison being transferred to nearby prisons
byline: All inmates of the Matara Prison are currently being transferred to nearby prisons, according to the Prisons Department Spokesman.

title: Indian HC meets ex-Presidents Mahinda and Ranil
byline: The Indian High Commissioner to Sri Lanka, Santosh Jha, has called on former Presidents Mahinda Rajapaksa and Ranil Wickremesinghe in separate meetings.

title: Three arrested over Dan Priyasad’s murder
byline: Three suspects have been arrested in connection with the murder of the convenor of the “Nawa Sinhale National Movement” and political activist, Dan Priyasad.

title: Pope Francis’ coffin arrives at St. Peter’s Basilica ahead of funeral
byline: Pope Francis’ coffin has arrived at St. Peter’s Basilica, where he will lie in state to allow the Catholic faithful to pay their respects before Saturday’s funeral that is expected to be attended by world leaders including US President Donald Trump.

title: Shani Abeysekara added to committee probing report on Easter attacks
byline: The Inspector General of Police (IGP) Priyantha Weerasooriya has appointed SSP Shani Abeysekara to the committee investigating the Presidential Report on the Easter Sunday attacks, increasing its members from four to five, the Police Spokesman said.

title: Devotees continue to queue up on day 6 of ‘Siri Dalada Wandanawa’
byline: The special exposition of the Sacred Tooth Relic, ‘Siri Dalada Wandanawa’, commenced today for the sixth consecutive day at the Temple of the Sacred Tooth Relic in Kandy, this afternoon (23) with large crowds continuously queuing up for veneration.

title: Foreign travel ban on father and son suspected in Dan Priyasad’s murder
byline: Wellampitiya Police today (23) reported the facts to the Colombo Magistrate’s Court regarding the murder of the convenor of the “Nawa Sinhale National Movement” and political activist, Dan Priyasad.

title: Committee led by SC judge appointed to investigate Deshabandu Tennakoon
byline: A Committee of Inquiry headed by a Supreme Court Judge has been appointed to investigate the allegations of misconduct and abuse of power against Inspector General of Police (IGP) Deshabandu Tennakoon.

title: Istanbul hit by 6.2 magnitude earthquake
byline: An earthquake with a preliminary magnitude of 6.2 shook Istanbul and other areas on Wednesday, Turkey’s disaster and emergency management agency said. There were no immediate reports of serious damage or injuries in the metropolis of 16 million.

title: ‘Siri Dalada Wandanawa’: Devotees urged to avoid arriving in next 2 days
byline: Sri Lanka Police says that presently there are over 300,000 devotees in queues awaiting to venerate the Sacred Tooth Relic in Kandy and therefore, urged the public to avoid coming tomorrow and the day after (April 24 and 25) and to choose an alternate date.

title: Delays expected on main line as train derails in Gampaha
byline: The Railway Department says that train delays are expected on the Main Line as a train has derailed near the Gampaha Railway Station.

title: Expert Committee confirms reason for Feb. 9 islandwide blackout
byline: The Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) today issued a clarification informing the public about the results of a comprehensive investigation conducted by an independent Expert Committee regarding the nationwide power outage that occurred on February 09, 2025.

title: Vance says US will ‘walk away’ unless Ukraine and Russia agree to proposals
byline: US Vice-President JD Vance said his country would “walk away” unless Ukraine and Russia agree on a deal, echoing recent comments from US officials.

title: Committee probing Deshabandu Tennakoon convenes first meeting
byline: The Committee of Inquiry appointed to inquire and report its findings on IGP T. M. W. Deshabandhu Tennakoon in respect of acts of gross abuse of power, met today (23) at the Parliamentary premises for the first time and held preliminary discussions.

title: Musk to reduce Doge role after Tesla profits plunge
byline: Tesla boss Elon Musk has pledged to “significantly” cut back his role in the US government after the electric car firm reported a huge drop in profit and sales for the start of this year.

title: India downgrades ties with Pakistan after attack on Kashmir tourists
byline: India announced a raft of measures to downgrade its ties with Pakistan on Wednesday, April 23, 2025, a day after suspected militants killed 26 men at a tourist destination in Kashmir in the worst attack on civilians in the country in nearly two decades.
